conclusion: Determine the pressure of the gas when the temperature is 600 K.
From the p-T graph, at T = 400 K, the pressure p = 1.0 x 10^5 Pa.
From the V-T graph, at T = 600 K, the volume V = 3 m^3.
The ideal gas law is PV = nRT, and we can use the relationship P1V1/T1 = P2V2/T2.
Initial state: P1 = 1.0 x 10^5 Pa, V1 = 2 m^3, T1 = 400 K. Final state: T2 = 600 K, V2 = 3 m^3.
Solve for the final pressure P2 using the formula P2 = P1 x (V1/V2) x (T2/T1).
The pressure of the gas when the temperature is 600 K is 1.0 x 10^5 Pa.
